de.must.appletserver
Class HTMLDialog

java.lang.Object
  de.must.appletserver.HTMLDialog
Direct Known Subclasses:
FileUploadDialog
public abstract class HTMLDialog
extends java.lang.Object

A dialog for stuff that cannot be done by an unsigned applet, e.g. file upload.

fetchValuesFromRequest

public void fetchValuesFromRequest(GeneralizedRequest request)

setMessageToKeepIfNotAlreadySet

protected void setMessageToKeepIfNotAlreadySet(java.lang.String messageToKeep)

messageToKeep - the message for the user

destroy

public final void destroy()
Destroys the frame. This may include
  • deregistering as main instance of a frame of this class
  • freeing used data components especially those with listeners, particularly those which are registered in static vectors
After the frame has been destroyed, it is not usable any more! Override free to add further destruction and don't forget to call super.free() at the end.

See Also:
free()

free

protected void free()
Frees (releases) references caused by this frame, particularly static register entries. To be called via destroy() to prevent multiple call. Override it to do additional releases and don't forget to call super.free() at the end.

See Also:
destroy()

finalize

protected final void finalize()
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
Called by the garbage collector. Calls free if the frame has not already been destroyed. Override free to add further releases and don't forget to call super.free() at the end.

Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable
See Also:
free(), destroy()
